После прохождения данной части Халф-Лайфа у меня остались исключительно только положительные эмоции. В данной части мы управляем за Адриана Шепарда за одного из капралов войск специального назначения HECU, у которых приказ , уничтожить всё живое в Чёрной Мезе , в том числе учённых и охранников (кстати из-за этих действии Гордон Фримен стал для них  в итоге самым главным врагом). 
В ходе прохождения Адриану Шепарду приходится воевать с врагами из мира Зен и Икс и с их этаких боссами  по мимо них ещё с Чёрными оперативниками  ( как то не особо логично что один спецназ уничтожает другой спецназ ) но всё же игра интересная.
  Игре ставлю 10 из 10 !

[h1]Rating[/h1]
7/10

[h1]Intro[/h1]
Often a popular favorite expansion pack among many, its title implies the story. It's the Black Mesa incident from the H.E.C.U.'s perspective. Also includes new enemies and weapons.

[h1]Positives[/h1]
+ Good soundtrack.
+ Good replay value.
+ Great enemy variety.
+ There's plenty of areas to explore for supplies.
+ Great weapon variety. While it may not have weapons like the Gluon Gun or Tau Cannon, we have some good replacements like the M249 or Shock Rifle.

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
- Enemies are bullet sponges on Hard difficulty.
- Friendly soldier A.I. can be a nuisance at times. There was even one instance, where one of them shot a propane tank next to me and killed me.

Half-Life: Opposing Force was the first expansion for the original Half-Life developed by Gearbox (Borderlands) and published by Valve.

The good? Storytelling, ALIENS, new weapons/tools, improved Squad AI, and new enemies.

The bad? Lackluster puzzles and ladders/ropes.....

I still think it is worth a playthrough if you enjoy Half-Life!

Life

[h1]Mejor que el original[/h1]

Antes de nada, tiene un bug con la cámara que se puede arreglar activando "raw mouse input" en las Settings.
 
Ahora... me parece una buena expansión del juego original. En la que plantea la historia paralela del HL1, y puedes ver eventos que ocurrieron en el anterior.
Aunque sea más lineal, el gameplay es más rápido y entretenido que el original. Y agrega buena cantidad de nuevas armas y nuevos enemigos.
La gran dificultad es un buen punto a favor.

Aunque tiene algunos errores bastante gordos, como que algunos textos (la mayoría) están doblados y otros no.
Quizás es demasiado lineal, y hay alguna mecánica, como la de la cuerda, que se utilizan 2 veces.
Los soundtracks están terriblemente mal ajustados a la acción.
Y la historia... sigue sin tener mucho sentido...

Aún así es un juego que permite echar unas horas entretenidas.

I think this is better than the original Half Life.

For a frame of reference, I beat the game on the hardest difficulty as I did Half Life.

Although this game is shorter, it feels more "fulfilling" than than Half Life did. In Half Life, I was exhausted by the time the credits rolled, while I was pleasantly surprised when this game ended. It was good conclusion with a nice difficulty spike at the end to test your knowledge with all of your weapons, and there a lot of them here.

I love that they replaced those bee guys with the tall laser cannon aliens (I'm sorry for butchering these aliens' names, but I don't want to look at the wiki for their names in case of spoilers). These guys felt intimidating, scary, and were a fun challenge every time they showed up. And the weapon they drop is LEAGUES better than the auto-aim bee gun. It shoots faster, sounds better, does not recharge passively, and the projectiles go much faster. And in this game, you get 2 additional alien weapons! That booger launcher was very reliable in rough spots, and that barnacle alien was very fun to mess around with (I even found a few skips due to it). But on top of having these and most of Half Life's weapons, Opposing Forces gives more powerful guns to play with, my favorite being the sniper and dislocator.

But Opposing Forces does heavily rely on the world Half Life set up so perfectly. It was a great expansion on that world, but it didn't put me in awe like Half Life did. Could be that I'm just getting used to it by now since I'm playing these Half Life games in rapid succession.

The story is pretty good too. It picks up when Freeman reaches the surface, which makes sense because you are playing as a soldier. It makes logical sense that you arrive at this point since the army would be calling in a lot of reinforcements due to the alien (and Freeman's) assault. And instead of trying to fix the problem like in Half Life, you are trying your best to just survive here. All in all, I appreciate what this game brings to the table without stepping on the toes of Half Life.

Also I see some Borderlands DNA here, but I won't spoil it. I like seeing these connections in games that share developers, and if you didn't know, this game was made in part by Gearbox. If you've played Borderlands before, you'll know when you get to it.

8/10 great continuation of the Half Life franchise. Has lower highs and higher lows than it's progenitor, which to me means makes it a generally better, if only by a little bit; even though I think I'd rather replay the original Half Life over this, Opposing Forces is still a solid game.

This game has not aged well. With no real story except the glimpses you get of Half-Life's story, there's nothing but a series of rooms to traverse, shoot a few enemies, hit a button, then move on to the next room.
Yes its amazing it brings back nostalgia i would definitely recommend it.

Para ser un Spin-Off de Half-Life está... decente.

Lo que más me llama la atención de este título, es en la variedad de armas. Sí, es obvio que aquí no cuentas con una pistola de gluones por ejemplo, sin embargo tiene un arsenal algo más extenso y con objetos que en una opinión personal hubiera sido genial tenerlo en el juego original, entre ellos obviamente están algunas armas del juego base, y con ellos los Barnacles que nos sirve para llegar a sitios inaccesibles, la Desert Eagle que es una pistola mucho más poderosa que la Glock e incluso el cañón Teletransportador que, como su nombre lo indica, nos permite teletransportarnos, aparte de matar a los enemigos de forma muy rápida y llevándonos a sitios particulares del juego. En cuanto a la historia, en mi opinión me pareció algo interesante por el hecho de que estamos jugando Half-Life pero desde otro ángulo o personaje: los acontecimientos no pasan al mismo tiempo que en el juego original sino unos capítulos más adelante. Eso sí, el final deja un sabor agridulce, ya que cuando acabas el juego, deja mucha intriga por el paradero de nuestro personaje, dejándonos en la incógnita. En cuanto a los enemigos pues son muy distintos a los de Half-Life, hay unos tipos llamados alienigenas de la raza "X" que llegan a tener algunas habilidades interesantes a primera vista (al menos para mí). Como el juego original, este juego cuenta con unos servidores casi vacíos, por lo que jugar en línea con gente random no es lo mejor que puedes hacer aquí.
En resumen: Si deseas probar algo nuevo a lo que viste en Half-Life, recomiendo bastante probar esta expansión. Tiene una gran variedad de armas, enemigos y una historia que lo compensa.

This game could've been so fucking cool if it was made nowadays... Currently the game is still enjoyable, but a lot of the things here either haven't aged very well, and while i do recognize that game length isn't everything, this game could really have used more playtime to play more around with all the interesting new enemies, the new weapons and the squad mechanics (which only really get significantly used once or twice all game).

Just one thing to point out: Don't play hard difficulty. It was most likely untested. It's really really bad.

10/10 half loaf

I actually think this is the weakest of the GoldSrc Half-Life games, but it's still worth checking out. My main gripes with it are the weapon selection doesn't feel as fleshed-out and balanced as the original Half-Life, some of the chapters in the midgame just feel like aimless filler and the last few chapters felt incredibly rushed. Other than that, it's authentic Half-Life but with some new stuff added in.

I like a lot of the weapons they added, my favourite being the Desert Eagle, which combines the raw power of the Revolver with the speed & consistency of the normal Pistol. The SAW (the machine gun) is a fun toy to play with when you do get the chance, since ammo is sparse and it chews through that stuff. The sniper rifle is basically just the crossbow but hitscan. 

The shockroach gun (or whatever it's called) is a better weapon than the hivehand (the weapon it replaces), but it doesn't have the shooting around corners niche, instead it's just an all-rounder (sorta like what the SMG and shotgun are for except  it doesn't require ammo). I'm not sure what the point of the spore launcher is. It's cute, i'll give them that, but you already have tons of explosives at that point. It's just sorta there.

You get to see so much more of Black Mesa, and so many things that raise questions (like stuff that was brought up back in Questionable Ethics), it's neat and I love it.

The introduced expanded enemies ("Race X" yeah really tried on the name there guys) are nice, but some of them are a pain in the ass to deal with. There's a part of the game where they just spam these giant walker-looking enemies that shoot energy orbs at you and have SO MUCH FUCKING HEALTH, ALL OF THEM. 

As alluded to earlier, this game seems to be a bit less generous with the ammo pickups than the original Half-Life (probably to encourage use of the Displacer), but there were parts of the game where I seriously had no ammo for like 50% of my weapons. So, watch out. 

Overall, it's good, but some of the things it tried weren't perfect in execution.

I personally didn't enjoy this game. The gameplay is literal pain and the enemies are extremely difficult even on the easiest difficulty. The original Half Life on the highest difficulty level is easier than this game on the lowest difficulty level. I uninstalled the game the moment I finished it because I honestly didn't enjoy it. In my opinion, Blue Shift is much better than this game, and I don't agree with anyone that says otherwise.
